When you get pretty far into a debate and see that you're losing, you claim your opponent has failed in EVERY WAY to prove his points. In a twisted way, it's a can't-lose method for you. The problem is, it's a calamity of fallacies, oh a multitude of fallacies. Ad Hominem, Moving Goalposts, Needling, Failure to State, some others, along with your standard, Emotive language. It makes a blanket statement that delays and frustrates your opponent, and attemps to bleed them of patience and time. If they attempt to go back and make more clear anything that they've said, then you turn up your fallacy use to further frustrate them. (usually more emotive language.) If your opponent gives up in frustration, then you have changed the SENTIMENTS, not the minds, of those who may tend to agree with you. 
 
 It's been your secret weapon, but now it's not so secret anymore, is it?
